name: Chelsea Inn - 17th Street

reviews.text: Chelsea Inn is in desperate need of modernisation but it's a great deal for Manhattan and the location was perfect. Right by Union Sq, walking distance to  East and West Village for nightlife. Plenty of not too pricey eating options around.
reviews.title: Don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed...

reviews.text: The place was clean  and the beds a little noisy but comfortable enough.  Shared bathrooms were fine, only shared with one other room.  There was a bit of a smell in the hallway but the room was always fine.  The receptionist could have been a little more welcoming but she did see to any of our requests quickly.  The lady cleaning the rooms in the morning really has to smile more.
reviews.title: A reasonable place to crash

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent at the wee Belgian bakery downstairs. Cup of tea / coffee and a bagel, pastry or muffin. You should definitely treat yourself to brunch at one point during your stay as their menu is excellent and not too pricey.
reviews.title: A big mistake

reviews.text: I would recommend this place but bear in mind it's not luxurious. Who goes to New York to sit in the hotel anyway?!
reviews.title: Pretty good for what it is
Good place to stay
reviews.text: With New York in a heat wave and our hosts without a/c my friend and I decided we needed a hotel room with a/c. The Chelsea Inn served as a reasonable place to crash at night with good air conditioning and location. Otherwise, the rooms are fairly small and in poor condition and the bathrooms pretty rough. The paint was peeling, the wiring frayed, and the room mostly clean. That said, We weren't looking for a whole lot and the hotel was convenient to everything we needed. As long as you go in knowing that it's not very nice but a good value then you'll be relatively pleased.
Remember, at these low prices, you will not get a 5 star experience, but then again, you wouldn't be reading this if you wanted a 5 star New York Hotel.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location, friendly staff, CLEAN rooms, breakfast included, Great Price!! Safe street.
A Great Little Place in the Heart of The Big Apple
reviews.text: First, extraordinary location, walk to LOTS of places, including several subway options. Walk to Union Square which is always amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, I always feel safe in the area and on the street. There are just enough late night places to grab a glass of wine or dinner or a club-and it's nice because the street is never deserted and scary. Always other people around.
reviews.title: Good location, okay amenities
great location, good hotel
reviews.text: Third, Rooms are CLEAN. I agree, not modern hotel furniture, but honestly each room is quaint and unique in it's own way, and it works. Beds are comfortable (I've stayed probably 8 different times).

Fourth, you can choose what is important to you and pay based on that. If you want a private bath, just book a room (usually a double bed) with a private room. There is a room with a double bed and a single bed for a third person-join your friends and share the bath.
reviews.title: Dingy and mixed performance from staff

reviews.text: I stayed for just over a week in a 3rd floor room at the front of the building. The staff were friendly. The room was incredibly warm and the window wouldn't stay open. The decor is awful. The breakfast is okay, but those serving you are not exactly friendly. The only real plus was that I didn't see any cockroaches. For a hotel of this standard that is a step up.
reviews.title: Very Hot and noisy

reviews.text: I stayed 5 nights at the Chelsea Inn. The staff were magnificant, the rooms were clean and quirky, the location however, is what made it. Near enough to walk to everything, close to the subway, and some fun little diners, shops and iconic places like the empire state building, battery park, alphabet city, the village etc etc. For all their proximity to everything, the rooms were quiet (i stayed in two different ones as i had a guest for 2 nights). I would highly recommend staying there!
reviews.title: Wonderful reception, great clean room, in the heart of everything

reviews.text: I was in NYC twice in 3 weeks for a business trip, stayed both time in here.
reviews.title: Good for a business stay

reviews.text: *Location*
reviews.title: It's fine, but a bit scary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a really convenient location not far from the Subway (it took me 20 min door to door to be in Century 21). Union square is also not far. There is enough restaurants and market around to satisfy all the needs and cravings.
reviews.title: Nice place if your standards are not too high

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Chelsea Inn twice, once in August of 2012 and again in March of 2013, both times with a friend and in a twin bed room with a shared bath. I was a little bit hesitant about a shared bath but as it turns out I had no need to worry. The bathroom is shared with just one other room and we never had a problem with it being occupied when we needed it and it was never obvious that it was being shared (no messes left behind, personal belongings, etc) but of course that would depend on your neighbor while staying there!
reviews.title: great location & price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The twin room is small and a bit cramped but being in New York City you're not likely to spend too much time in your room anyway. In the room were two twin beds with space enough for just one person to get through the middle, a dresser, tv, sink, small fridge, table and chair and a very large closet.
reviews.title: Very good value for location

reviews.text: Everything about the hotel is clean - rooms, bathroom, lobby. It is an older building with older furnishings but with loads of charm. There is no elevator and you will have to carry your luggage up several flights of stairs. If you arrive early there is a drop off area for your luggage to be held until you come back later to check in. Very handy! The hotel does not provide meals on site but you do get a voucher for each day that you are there for breakfast at a cute little restaurant next door. The voucher though is for a drink and a bagel or something similar, not a full breakfast.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for & it isn't much.
You get what you pay for.
reviews.text: The location is wonderful. It is within walking distance of Union Square, Penn Station and there are several subway stops within a few blocks. I'm sure that I'll be staying here again. The price and the location can't be beat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed here with another couple we had separate rooms and shared one bath between us which worked out very nicely. Very clean, small rooms in the front. We did not find it too noisy. Lumpy beds in my room, but my friends said their bed was comfortable. A great location for seeing lower and mid town. Breakfast vouchers (pastry or bagel and coffee/tea) are included for the french cafe next door. No frills but I'd stay again.
reviews.title: great value, wonderful location

description: Chelsea Inn is a small boutique bed and breakfast style hotel located in one of the most trendy parts of New York City - Chelsea.
